Note:
Listed by Greene by burden; see Greene (1977)
XGreene, Richard Leighton. The Early English Carols. Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon, 1977 (see also Greene (1935)
XGreene, Richard Leighton. The Early English Carols. Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon, 1977), 355.
_description: Of the Nativity — three 2-line stanzas and burden: ‘Mayde and moder glade thou be / For nou þou myst [th]y son ysee’

YaleBeiOsa1.First Lines:
Mayde and moder glade þou befor nou þou myst [þi]
                    son y seeþat ix monþes he [ ] was enclus…
YaleBeiOsa1.Last Lines:
…and ro[ ]e [sla?] þeȝ be nou yeȝmay youre son
                    y sese
YaleBeiOsa1.Note: On a flyleaf. Rhyme and meter deteriorate over 12 lines.
